data.enText: a thin pointed piece of metal like a nail with a raised spiral line (called a thread ) along it and a line or cross cut into its head. Screws are turned and pressed into wood, metal, etc. with a screwdriver in order to fasten two things together.
One of the screws is loose.

data.chText: 现在把全部螺丝都拧紧。
data.enText: Now tighten all the screws.
an act of turning a screw
an act of having sex
a partner in sex
a good screw
a propeller on a ship, a boat or an aircraft
a prison officer
have a screw loose

data.chText: 举止略有异常；行为稍嫌古怪
data.enText: to be slightly strange in your behaviour
put the screws on (sb)
to force sb to do sth by frightening and threatening them
a turn of the screw
an extra amount of pressure, cruelty , etc. added to a situation that is already difficult to bear or understand
to fasten one thing to another or make sth tight with a screw or screws

data.chText: 书架用螺丝固定在墙上了。
data.enText: The bookcase is screwed to the wall.

data.chText: 你得用螺丝把所有的零件固定在一起。
data.enText: You need to screw all the parts together.

data.chText: 现在用螺丝将盖子固定好。
data.enText: Now screw down the lid.
to twist sth around in order to fasten it in place

data.chText: 她又把广口瓶的盖子拧上。
data.enText: She screwed the cap back on the jar.
Screw the bolt tight.
to be attached by screwing

data.chText: 把灯泡拧到灯口上就行。
data.enText: The bulb should just screw into the socket.
The lid simply screws on.
to squeeze sth, especially a piece of paper, into a tight ball

data.chText: 我把那封信揉成一团，扔进了火里。
data.enText: I screwed up the letter and threw it into the fire.
Screw the foil into a little ball.
to cheat sb, especially by making them pay too much money for sth
We've been screwed.
How much did they screw you for (= how much did you have to pay) ?
to have sex with sb
screw him, you, that, etc.

data.enText: an offensive way of showing that you are annoyed or do not care about sb/sth

tr: a fastener with a tapered threaded shank and a slotted head
a propeller with several angled blades that rotates to push against water or air
a simple machine of the inclined-plane type consisting of a spirally threaded cylindrical rod that engages with a similarly threaded hole
defeat someone through trickery or deceit
tighten or fasten by means of screwing motions
cause to penetrate, as with a circular motion

example: This student sleeps with everyone in her dorm
Were you ever intimate with this man?

value.def: A screw is a metal object similar to a nail, with a raised spiral line around it. You turn a screw using a screwdriver so that it goes through two things, for example two pieces of wood, and fastens them together.

example.ex: Each bracket is fixed to the wall with just three screws.
example.tran: 每个托架只用了 3 颗螺钉固定在墙上。

value.def: If you screw something somewhere or if it screws somewhere, you fix it in place by means of a screw or screws.

example.ex: I had screwed the shelf on the wall myself...
example.tran: 我自己用螺钉把架子固定在墙上。
用螺钉固定住所有松动的地板。

example.ex: I particularly like the type of shelving that screws to the wall.
example.tran: 我尤其喜欢那种用螺钉固定在墙上的搁板。

value.def: A screw lid or fitting is one that has a raised spiral line on the inside or outside of it, so that it can be fixed in place by twisting.

example.ex: ...an ordinary jam jar with a screw lid.
example.tran: 带螺旋盖的普通果酱罐

value.def: If you screw something somewhere or if it screws somewhere, you fix it in place by twisting it round and round.

example.ex: Kelly screwed the silencer onto the pistol...
example.tran: 凯利把消音器拧到手枪上。

example.ex: Screw down the lid fairly tightly...
This device screws into the shutter release button.
example.tran: 这个装置能旋进快门释放按钮。

example.ex: ...several aluminium poles that screw together to give a maximum length of 10 yards.
example.tran: 几根旋接在一起、最长为 10 码的铝杆

value.def: If you screw something such as a piece of paper into a ball, you squeeze it or twist it tightly so that it is in the shape of a ball.

example.ex: He screwed the paper into a ball and tossed it into the fire.
example.tran: 他把纸揉成一团抛进火里。

value.tran: 把(纸等)揉成一团，拧成一团

value.boxr_value: in AM, use 美国英语用 crush

value.def: If you screw your face or your eyes into a particular expression, you tighten the muscles of your face to form that expression, for example because you are in pain or because the light is too bright.

example.ex: He screwed his face into an expression of mock pain.

value.def: If someone screws someone else or if two people screw, they have sex together.
Some people use screw in expressions such as screw you or screw that to show that they are not concerned about someone or something or that they feel contempt for them.
If someone says that they have been screwed, they mean that someone else has cheated them, especially by getting money from them dishonestly.

example.ex: They haven't given us accurate information. We've been screwed...
example.tran: 他们没有提供准确的消息。我们被骗了。

example.ex: The consumer is getting screwed by cover charges as well.
example.tran: 这名消费者也被诈取了服务费。

value.def: If someone screws something, especially money, out of you, they get it from you by putting pressure on you.

example.ex: For decades rich nations have been screwing money out of poor nations.
example.tran: 富国压榨穷国长达数十载。

value.def: Prisoners often refer to prison officers as screws .
A screw is a propeller on a ship or an aircraft.
If you turn or tighten the screw on someone, you increase the pressure which is already on them, for example by using threats, in order to force them to do a particular thing.

example.ex: Parisian taxi drivers are threatening to mount a blockade to turn the screw on the government.
example.tran: 巴黎出租车司机们正威胁阻塞交通以对政府进一步施压。

gramarinfo.label: V and N inflect, oft PHR <l>on</l> n

value.def: You can refer to each of a series of threats or actions which are intended to force someone to do a particular thing as another turn of the screw .

example.ex: Every rebel raid is another turn of the screw, increasing the pressure on the President.
example.tran: 每次叛乱分子发动袭击就是又往前逼进了一步，使得总统的压力越来越大。

value.tran: 愈逼愈紧的压力(或行动)
